TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a claim for a SAML security token that asserts the subject's name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource class to create a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> instance for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> subject name claim. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim> class has a constructor that takes a resource, which this class can be passed to.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>. A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token. This principal is specified using a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class. The SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource class represents the name identifier for a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject>.

MemberSignature.Value: public SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource (string name, string nameQualifier, string format);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string nameQualifier, string format) cil managed

Docs.param: The subject name. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.
The domain in which the `name` parameter resides. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.NameQualifier%2A> property.
A URI reference that represents the format that the `name` parameter is in. Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Format%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: An object to compare to this instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the instance is equal to the specified object.
Docs.returns: if is a and has the same value as this instance; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Docs.value: A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Format property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
|Format|Description| |------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.EmailNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.UserNameNamespace%2A>|A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.|
The Format property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for the .
Gets the subject name of a SAML security token.
Docs.value: The subject name of a security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Format%2A> property specifies the format that the Name property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the Name property resides in.
The Name property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

Docs.summary: Gets the domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
Docs.value: The domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The NameQualifier property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlNameIdentifierClaimResource.Name%2A> property resides in.
The NameQualifier property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
